title: Patch 6.15 - The One Where The Towers Change
body:
Welcome back to Patch Chat!

I’m Gentleman Gustaf, and here with me is Riot’s Playtest Team, a group of high-ranking League players whose job it is to play the hell out of things and give actionable objective feedback to designers. Think of us as your high-Elo friends who happen to have played the new patch, rework, or champion long before it ever came out.

Every two weeks, concurrent with the release of [patch notes](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/patch/patch-615-notes), we’re going to be hosting a discussion here on Dev Corner. **Take this opportunity to ask us any questions about how we feel about the game or what it’s like to work as a Riot playtester**.

Several of our playtesters have competitive experience with lane swaps, so if you want to know how we think they will affect lane swaps - or just regular play - leave your questions below!

In competitive play, we expect to see fewer fast-push lane swaps. Specifically, we expect that lane swaps will now at least be contested, thanks to the value of tower first blood and the weaker bot side towers. This may change after the first five minutes of the game, but by then champions have their full basic kits (no ultimates yet) and can take better advantage of the mechanical aspects of the game in additional to the tactical.

In solo queue, we think that champions who can poke towers early on (Caitlyn?) might have the **option** of taking towers somewhat earlier, but that it probably won’t have much of an impact.

We will be around for the next few hours and will try to answer as many questions as possible.

replies.body: That change actually didn't go through -- Cannon minion functionality will be the same.
Anyway, it was already 1 every 3 waves before, no? It's just the timing that would have been modified.

I'm pretty sure that's not the case. If you look at the cost efficiency of gold generation items on the Wikia, you can see that the computations are done with a canon in every third wave before the 20 minutes mark.

See: http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Ancient_Coin for instance.
Have there been any interesting developments from top lane not getting a siege minion until wave 5? Seems like there'd be some shifts in power spikes and what not.
This changed was pulled last minute and will not be in the patch.

Any thoughts on buffing Ziggs' W AP ratio? It's a very low 35% AP ratio for a 26 sec. CD ability. Ziggs has the slowest MS of any mage so using his only escape for damage should provide more reward. I often want to play Ziggs in a riskier style with W but it rarely feels worth it.

Ziggs's winrate is solid right now so he probably doesn't need a straight buff-  if you meant keeping his overall damage equal but putting more of the power in the W and taking it off his Q or E, IMO that would feel bad since you're *always* using the Q/E in your burst combo but only using the W a fraction of the time. In other words, W would still be best used as a utility spell so it would feel worse to give up more damage in those cases.

The cooldown is too long to abuse this ability and he also depends on the utility. His all-in dueling would be better but it would still not be something he's good at. I think he deserves a minor bump in W damage because he leaves a lot to be desired late game and isn't really a lane bully either (he might poke you a bit but it's not a kill threat unless you choose to disrespect him). 

His utility is mediocre so all he really has is decent consistent damage. Just compare Ziggs to the massive utiltiy and safety of Anivia. I'd say her damage is on par or better than his while she has far better zone control, more safety, more utility and more burst. Leauge might already have too many champions at this point. I'm not saying they can't add more, but the number is getting unwieldy from a balance perspective given how many different comps. can be created. You already see this because only about half the roster is used with any regularity so the number of champions, while large on paper, isn't really relevant. 

Until League actually can claim to make use of its full champion roster, it seems silly to add more (at least from a game perspective rather than business). I still remember how Blizzard was actively removing units from SC2 early on due to lack of sufficient gameplay function to offset the balance issues they invariably create. With that said, it's too early to judge Kled. He seems fun to play but may not be fun for opponents. ;D

What are your thoughts on this meta heading into worlds? 

It seems to me, once again pretty stale in the jungle especially.

Also seems unfortunate that the meta is so dominated by kind of more boring champions like Malzahar, while fun champions that are hated by... certain players... like Zed, were really very overnerfed. I'll add thresh, kalista, riven and lee sin to the list. This probably won't earn me any popularity points on the whiniest boards I've ever seen, but those champions are fun to watch and they don't deserve to be so low tier either. I'll also say Azir is a lot of fun to watch and he definitely got Olaf'd to hell but I understand he was crowding out mid lane a lot. On the other hand it doesn't seem to have helped open up the mid lane meta much yet

I guess what I want to know is, is the meta wide enough to support an interesting Worlds right now, and is there time to shake it up a little more, before we're locked into super minor changes that don't change anything (ie the ezreal and corki buffs last year)

I personally don't find Zed fun at all, it almost feels like his kit automatically outplays for you. Most skillful plays involve him porting to a shadow to dodge something, which honestly requires very little thought (especially with his ulti) and is heavily weighed in his favor in terms of counterplay - if he ultis you over a wall and you can't kill him in one second (or however long you can cc him) he'll just blink away. And swapping to his W shadow then his R shadow (or vice versa) isn't exciting because again, if he placed his shadows in a not-stupid location it's easy to blink away without any consequence.

I think you're overstating how easy it is to make plays with his shadows. and overlapping shurikents dramatically increases your damage.

its also pretty easy to counter his ult so that he doesn't kill you, between exhaust and zhonyas.

in fact i'd guess you don't really play zed you just don't like playing against him. people trying to say zed isn't a high skill cap champ with a lot of room for different plays, are frankly full of shit. same goes with many of the other champs that are popular to hate, like yasuo leblanc azir lee sin etc

I think riot should have buffed some of the champs with high difficulty caps especially zed. Not saying that hes not powerful enough but overall just felt like they should be balancing a champ based on damage output, difficulties, health, ability power, etc

tbh this is always going to happen, because jungle is much less about matchups and more about overall game impact, so the champs with the most desirable interactions with the game are going to be the most played. it's actually not too bad that there are 5 junglers now in pro play (the champs you listed plus Graves). last worlds it was like 3 junglers, really terrible. as long as the rest of the jungle cast is ok in normal play, it's not that bad. plus someone always plays lee sin and there's some occasional pocket picks with reignover's olaf or inori's rengar. really the jungle is tons better than last worlds, and I'm sure they're always working to add a bit more diversity.

the biggest issue is that there are fewer risky invades because pro teams are better at countering it, so the super invade fighter type junglers (pantheon, shyvana) are not as good in pro play.
